At the inception of stats, I remember we wanted to do both TT and ARAM. However, as you know TT and ARAM are drastically different game modes. Hey just out of curiosity, what ARAM stats would you want to see that is helpful towards learning/making meaningful choices? Its an area we explored, but couldn't find a good handful(then again I'm not a hardcore ARAM player).

Speaking for only myself with the option for per champion variations of most of these:
1) First Blood Involvement (Both being the one to give it up and being involved in getting it)
2) CS score (can be relevant to certain champs)
3) KDA
4) Death streaks? Not quite sure how to phrase it, but basically how frequently do you die. 10 deaths in a 40 minute ARAM is great, 10 in 10 minutes isn't. But I've noticed I have a tendency to die a whole bunch in a match at some point, but be stable before and after. Could be useful to see where that spike is happening in game.
5) Damage Contribution
6) CC contribution
7) RUNES! I would love a more aggregate way to look at rune damages in general (say if I run electrocute vs predator, win percentages and am I doing better or worse with those runes then other players with those runes)
8) Build paths/Items (win percentages with Frostfang vs without, or compared to others etc.)

As someone who plays ARAM a fair amount, these would be useful for me in helping to improve.

I play mostly ARAM, and I would -love- to be able to see a breakdown of my damage at the end of the game in terms of what skills they came from.

For me, this is because of course I have my favourites that I play, but learning a new champ even in a rough-and-tumble mode such as ARAM, I like to try new builds and ways of playing. Of course at the end of every game I can see my damage, but not knowing _where_ that damage is coming from makes it difficult to really see if this build worked better than that one, and I just did less damage overall because it was a rough game. Did building that Stormrazor on Gangplank -really- make that big of a difference to the damage I did through Q compared to the last game I didn't build it, for example?

Other stats that would be awesome to see would be things like turret stats (damage to turrets during turret enemy fire, damage to champs during turret enemy fire, that kind of thing). 

Also would be heaps keen to see something like percentage of activity, i.e how much of the game you actually 'did' something (and I'm not just saying that as I would have _loved_ statistical evidence against the loser who requested an entire team report me for 'afking in the bush' as Teemo that one time, which was a **total** lie, I was only there for maybe 3 seconds trying to blind someone into a mushroom :|) but just to have an overview of the flow of different champs and how 'involved' they are through a match (i.e being able to compare the spell slinging of a Ryze vs a Morgana and see average damage per spell).

Anyhow, I don't think the majority of ARAM players (even those who play it primarily like myself) want particularly hardcore or even _useful_ stats, we just want to be included in the fun new shiny stuff too!

I don't know if you have a designated place for feedback about this particular Stat Page feature, but...

The Support average is improperly including games where the player has clearly played ADC and it throws off both Bot and Support stats. It happens even if the champion played is an ADC, the role in draft is Bot and the other Bot player is playing a support champion.

I believe the system is identifying the role as Support in cases where the "real" Support has performed better than the "real" ADC in some stats. That could sound reasonable...but it distorts the stats for both roles on the player record. If the player plays some bad ADC games they should still be counted as ADC games to reflect the true role performance. If they are classified as Support perfromances the ADC stats will show better averages than reality, and the Suppot stats will also be affected.

Aside: Riot also does that when assigning Champion Performance Grades (S,A,B,C...) for a game. One can play a bad ADC, the Support does better than the ADC, then the system gives one an A- . The system is clearly rating it as a great Support performance instead of the bad ADC performance it is.

Hey! It would be good if you can send me an example of this. I can have a better look. Our position detection for stats does not go by your role you are selected into for Champ Select. It takes a variety of things in factor and we have pretty great success rate for detecting which position you actually played in game. Moreover, there are some stats our systems deem as "questionable" and we did not include into the aggregated stats.
